00064 using std::cerr;
00065 using std::endl;
00066 
00067 UInt16::UInt16(const string &n) 
00068     : BaseType(n, dods_uint16_c, (xdrproc_t)XDR_UINT16)
00069 {
00070 }
00071 
00072 UInt16::UInt16(const UInt16 &copy_from) : BaseType(copy_from)
00073 {
00074     _buf = copy_from._buf;
00075 }
00076     
00077 BaseType *
00078 UInt16::ptr_duplicate()
00079 {
00080     return new UInt16(*this);
00081 }
00082 
00083 UInt16 &
00084 UInt16::operator=(const UInt16 &rhs)
00085 {
00086     if (this == &rhs)
00087     return *this;
00088 
00089     dynamic_cast<BaseType &>(*this) = rhs;
00090 
00091     _buf = rhs._buf;
00092 
00093     return *this;
00094 }
00095 
00096 unsigned int
00097 UInt16::width()
00098 {
00099     return sizeof(dods_uint16);
00100 }
00101 
00102 bool
00103 UInt16::serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00104           bool ce_eval)
00105 {
00106     dds.timeout_on();
00107 
00108     if (!read_p())
00109     read(dataset);      // read() throws Error and InternalErr
00110 
00111     if (ce_eval && !dds.eval_selection(dataset))
00112     return true;
00113 
00114     dds.timeout_off();
00115 
00116     if (!XDR_UINT16(sink, &_buf))
00117     throw Error(
00118 "Network I/O Error. Could not send uint 16 data. This may be due to a\n\
00119 bug in DODS or a problem with the network connection.");
00120 
00121     return true;
00122 }
00123 
00124 bool
00125 UInt16::deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *, bool)
00126 {
00127     if (!XDR_UINT16(source, &_buf))
00128     throw Error(
00129 "Network I/O Error. Could not read uint 16 data. This may be due to a\n\
00130 bug in DODS or a problem with the network connection.");
00131 
00132     return false;
00133 }
00134 
00135 unsigned int
00136 UInt16::val2buf(void *val, bool)
00137 {
00138     // Jose Garcia
00139     // This method is public therefore and I believe it has being designed
00140     // to be use by read which must be implemented on the surrogated library,
00141     // thus if the pointer val is NULL, is an Internal Error. 
00142     if(!val)
00143     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, 
00144               "The incoming pointer does not contain any data.");
00145 
00146     _buf = *(dods_uint16 *)val;
00147 
00148     return width();
00149 }
00150 
00151 unsigned int
00152 UInt16::buf2val(void **val)
00153 {
00154     // Jose Garcia
00155     // The same comment justifying throwing an Error in val2buf applies here.
00156     if (!val)
00157     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "NULL pointer.");
00158 
00159     if (!*val)
00160     *val = new dods_uint16;
00161 
00162     *(dods_uint16 *)*val =_buf;
00163 
00164     return width();
00165 }
00166 
00167 // Print BUF to stdout with its declaration. Intended mostly for debugging.
00168 
00169 void 
00170 UInt16::print_val(ostream &os, string space, bool print_decl_p)
00171 {
00172     if (print_decl_p) {
00173     print_decl(os, space, false);
00174     os << " = " << _buf << ";" << endl;
00175     }
00176     else 
00177     os << _buf;
00178 }
00179 
00180 void 
00181 UInt16::print_val(FILE *out, string space, bool print_decl_p)
00182 {
00183     if (print_decl_p) {
00184     print_decl(out, space, false);
00185     fprintf( out, " = %u;\n", (unsigned int)_buf ) ;
00186     }
00187     else 
00188     fprintf( out, "%u", (unsigned int)_buf ) ;
00189 }
00190 
00191 bool
00192 UInt16::ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset)
00193 {
00194     // Extract the Byte arg's value.
00195     if (!read_p() && !read(dataset)) {
00196     // Jose Garcia
00197     // Since the read method is virtual and implemented outside
00198     // libdap++ if we can not read the data that is the problem 
00199     // of the user or of whoever wrote the surrogate library
00200     // implemeting read therefore it is an internal error.
00201     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "This value was not read!");
00202     }
00203 
00204     // Extract the second arg's value.
00205     if (!b->read_p() && !b->read(dataset)) {
00206     // Jose Garcia
00207     // Since the read method is virtual and implemented outside
00208     // libdap++ if we can not read the data that is the problem 
00209     // of the user or of whoever wrote the surrogate library
00210     // implemeting read therefore it is an internal error.
00211     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "This value was not read!");
00212     }
00213 
00214     switch (b->type()) {
00215       case dods_byte_c:
00216     return rops<dods_uint16, dods_byte, Cmp<dods_uint16, dods_byte> >
00217         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Byte *>(b)->_buf, op);
00218       case dods_int16_c:
00219     return rops<dods_uint16, dods_int16, USCmp<dods_uint16, dods_int16> >
00220         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Int16 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00221       case dods_uint16_c:
00222     return rops<dods_uint16, dods_uint16, Cmp<dods_uint16, dods_uint16> >
00223         (_buf, dynamic_cast<UInt16 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00224       case dods_int32_c:
00225     return rops<dods_uint16, dods_int32, USCmp<dods_uint16, dods_int32> >
00226         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Int32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00227       case dods_uint32_c:
00228     return rops<dods_uint16, dods_uint32, Cmp<dods_uint16, dods_uint32> >
00229         (_buf, dynamic_cast<UInt32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00230       case dods_float32_c:
00231     return rops<dods_uint16, dods_float32, Cmp<dods_uint16, dods_float32> >
00232         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Float32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00233       case dods_float64_c:
00234     return rops<dods_uint16, dods_float64, Cmp<dods_uint16, dods_float64> >
00235         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Float64 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00236       default:
00237     return false;
00238     }
00239 }

00252 // depracated.
00253 // Added 'smart timeouts' to all the variable classes. This means that
00254 // the new server timeouts are active only for the data read and CE
00255 // evaluation. This went inthe BaseType::serialize() methods because it
00256 // needed to time both the read() calls and the dds::eval() calls.

00297 // Revision 1.15.4.4  2001/10/02 17:01:52  jimg
00298 // Made the behavior of serialize and deserialize uniform. Both methods now
00299 // use Error exceptions to signal problems with network I/O and InternalErr
00300 // exceptions to signal other problems. The return codes, always true for
00301 // serialize and always false for deserialize, are now meaningless. However,
00302 // by always returning a code that means OK, old code should continue to work.
00303 //
00304 // Revision 1.17  2001/09/28 17:50:07  jimg
00305 // Merged with 3.2.7.
00306 //
00307 // Revision 1.15.4.3  2001/09/07 00:38:35  jimg
00308 // Sequence::deserialize(...) now reads all the sequence values at once.
00309 // Its call semantics are the same as the other classes' versions. Values
00310 // are stored in the Sequence object using a vector<BaseType *> for each
00311 // row (those are themselves held in a vector). Three new accessor methods
00312 // have been added to Sequence (row_value() and two versions of var_value()).
00313 // BaseType::deserialize(...) now always returns true. This matches with the
00314 // expectations of most client code (the seqeunce version returned false
00315 // when it was done reading, but all the calls for sequences must be changed
00316 // anyway). If an XDR error is found, deserialize throws InternalErr.
00317 //
00318 // Revision 1.16  2001/08/24 17:46:22  jimg
00319 // Resolved conflicts from the merge of release 3.2.6
00320 //
00321 // Revision 1.15.4.2  2001/08/18 00:14:23  jimg
00322 // Removed WIN32 compile guards from using statements.
00323 //
00324 // Revision 1.15.4.1  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00325 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00326 // I added those where they were needed.
00327 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00328 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00329 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00330 // just good form when using delete.
00331 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00332 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00333 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00334 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00335 // characters on their own.
00336 //
00337 // Revision 1.15  2000/10/06 01:26:05  jimg
00338 // Changed the way serialize() calls read(). The status from read() is
00339 // returned by the Structure and Sequence serialize() methods; ignored by
00340 // all others. Any exceptions thrown by read() are caught and discarded.
00341 // serialize() returns false if read() throws an exception. This should
00342 // be fixed once all the servers build using the new read() definition.
00343 //
00344 // Revision 1.14  2000/09/22 02:17:21  jimg

00349 //
00350 // Revision 1.13  2000/09/21 16:22:09  jimg
00351 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00352 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00353 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00354 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00355 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00356 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00357 //
